Reviews.Title: “Excellent, beyond my expectations.”
Reviews.Author: gnewey
Reviews.Content: My room wasn't ready when I arrived, was not ready for awhile more after, but the staff was very apologetic and nice about it. Even offered me another room to rest in. When I finally got into my room, I was so happy with it. It was a big suite, large sleeping area, couch, desk, lounge, kitchen. The bed was a firm spring bed with feather pillows, the shower water was hot and powerful, the windows were big and can be opened wide. Free wifi, coffee, tea. The location was really nice, not for from everything, but far enough for some sanity and quiet. But it gets noisy at night, the Saturday I was there, not unbearable. I was on the front of the building on the second floor. Overall, I would give this hotel an A+.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel in the best neighborhood in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: Parisatheart
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Ansen Suites for seven nights and couldn't have been happier. We had an enormous room (by European standards) overlooking the Bosphorus. The staff was attentive and sweet, rooms were impeccably clean and the location - oh my the location!! We were moments away from the best restaurants, shopping, bars. The price is also very reasonable. I really couldn't say enough about our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel. Taxi scam. Possible cause of my stomach bug?”
Reviews.Author: dYquem
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel recently and was not overly impressed. While the room was quite spacy and well-decorated, it took me a couple of minutes to work out how to turn the lights on (it was evening - no lighting in the corridor - and had to find an invisible card slot to turn on the room lights) and even longer to work out how to turn them all off when I went to sleep. It would have been nice if the staff had helped with this (they were not particularly busy). The mattress was as hard as wood and the pillows made of lumpy synthetic material. I ate breakfast in the hotel, including what was meant to have been a hard-boiled egg, but was actually soft-boiled. I didn't have lunch, but had a light dinner in the hotel that evening. I was suffering with severe gastric problems for almost a week afterwards. I've no evidence that this was the cause of the problem, but it was the only food I ate and I only drank sealed mineral water, so I think it's reasonable for me to query whether there is a causal link (hence the question mark in the title). The Italian restaurant food wasn't great. The final insult was an attempt to extort â‚¬40 for a short journey that actually cost under TL20. The hotel staff refused to hail a cab off the street, but insisted on calling a service. I was not impressed. I don't think I'll be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to feel right at home”
Reviews.Author: AdventurJunkie
Reviews.Content: The location is ideal close to the bars, restaurants and sights. Accessible since it is streets away from the Tunel and the metro. The rooms are extremely comfortable with a relaxed, chilled out style to them. The best part is the size of the rooms, plenty of space to stretch out and enjoy yourself. Everyone at Ansen Suites went out of their way to ensure our stay in the city was enjoyable. Thoroughly enjoyed the experience and will definitely stay there again when I (hopefully) return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “A little more is needed to get it to 5 :)”
Reviews.Author: vfmtraveler
Reviews.Content: Will endorse positive views of previous reviewers on size of room, location, friendliness of staff and breakfast. I stayed in 101, no stink, but the bathroom is not deluxe. The shower has an impractical head, shoots straight at incredible pressure. It could do with a conventional head. Staff spoke english very well. Our dinner experience at the restaurant below was mixed. It is subjective of course that we found it very expensive: almost 200 Lira/80 Euros for a simple meal for three. The chef speaks excellent english but will not listen :). Will stay here again if I can, but am curious about the other hotels in the area as well that look nice as well.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to stay..huge clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: stefeec
Reviews.Content: excellent locatÄ±on..rooms large enough to be an luxury apartment Ä±n los angeles..dollar for dollar worth every bÄ±t and more..the staff Ä±s extremely helpful..Ä± wÄ±ll be comÄ±ng back to turkey because not only Ä±s Ä±stanbul such a overwhelmÄ±ng cÄ±ty but there Ä±s so much to do and even after a week Ä± need more..Ä± wÄ±ll defÄ±nÄ±tely be only stayÄ±ng at thÄ±s hotel..Ä± was surprÄ±sed that Ä±t was not a hÄ±gher score on trÄ±p advÄ±sor as Ä± would expect Ä±t to be hÄ±gher...there Ä±s no better optÄ±on Ä±n thÄ±s prÄ±ce range...Ä±n fact Ä±ts more sÄ±mÄ±lar to optÄ±ons that are double Ä±ts prÄ±ce...defÄ±nÄ±tely go dÄ±rect to theÄ±r websÄ±te so you can see better Ä±mages of theÄ±r rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and spaceous rooms”
Reviews.Author: ABCinNYC
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved our stay at the Ansen suites in Istanbul. The location was perfect, central to all the tourist attractions but right in the heart of the fantastic nightlife. Just two blocks away was a slew a of restaurants and bars that were packed every night. The staff was extremely friendly and accomodating, the only negative is that not everyone's English was very good. We had a few times where we couldn't really communicate with them which was a bit frustrating. The breakfast provided was nice, nothing hot, but extensive enough. Probably the highlight of our stay was the room itself. It was really large with modern furnishing and a very comfortable feel. We felt as though we were in our own apartment and not in a hotel room. The rooms are also very quiet and you are provided with an inroom safe and free wireless internet. Definitely a great choice for travelers to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great Loaction.. Only Suites”
Reviews.Author: TarunJagwani
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, with only 11 rooms all different all suites. My friends and I visited Istanbul for my bachelorâ€™s party and loved the city. The hotels are a small restaurant in which breakfast was served every morning. All rooms also have Wi-Fi, and have a kitchenette as well. This hotel is located 2 minutes walking distance from Istiklal which is filled with bars, restaurants and clubs. There is a great pizzeria and bar around the corner from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great locations and spacious rooms, but some reservations”
Reviews.Author: trips1974
Reviews.Content: -Location- close to some of the best restaurants and bars, a good area to stay in, and the hotel is on a side street so you're away from the bustle whilst being close to the action. Getting to sultanahmet was a bit of a pain - taxis are cheap but traffic is a big problem in istanbul. we tended to walk, despite the heat. - Rooms - really spacious and comfortable, with large modern bathrooms. Huge bed. Good shower. No bath. hairdryer provided. Kitchen, but no pans or cutlery - not sure how you'd use these. Rooms have no view, and we had some street noise at the weekend. - Internet connection was not great. -Staff/atmosphere. Most of the staff were really nice and friendly, but most did not speak English. Despite being a modern 'boutique' hotel, there was something of the chain hotel about the staff uniforms and badges, and the manager was a little brusque and intimidating, which made us reluctant to eat at the hotel/bistro other than for breakfast. The atmosphere was not relaxing, it was the kind of place where you keep to your room, but I would not fault the rooms themselves or the location of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “boutique hotel with huge rooms”
Reviews.Author: GaryMW
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this very well located hotel for 5 nights in June 2010. Our rooms were huge! and also clean and comfortable. The hotel only has 10 rooms I believe. The rooms facing the front of the hotel are larger but do not have a view. The back facing rooms have a view if you go up a few floors, but are not as large. Attentive service (for the most part). Good breakfast. My only issue: They did neglect to pass on a message (from a Turk, so it wasn't a language issue). There are a lot of cafes, bars and restaurants nearby. A great neighborhood to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here - you won't regret it”
Reviews.Author: MOBec1
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was excellent, staff were friendly, the rooms were spacious and well designed. The location is close to the Galata Tower and is close to excellent restaurants, bars and shopping on Istigal Caddesi. Sultanahmet is a very pleasant walk accross the Galata Bridge. The location provides for excellent access to the main attactions in Istanbul - but is away from the madding crowd. If we go back to Istanbul we will probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Spacious”
Reviews.Author: Akshay310
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Istanbul with a group of 9 friends. We were totally amazed by the size of the rooms. For the price, the room quality is absolutely brilliant. The rooms in itself are done up really well and even though the hotel is 5 years old, it feels like it has been constructed just yesterday. The staff is extremely helpful and the they will get you whatever you need. Now, we had 4 rooms, thats why I am able to say this - amongst all the rooms, I liked 310 the best. It has some huge windows and has a good view of the Bosphorous as well. I can imagine that 410 will be even better. The other rooms, i,e. 101, 201, 301, etc. are street facing and I particularly felt a little weird even though the size of the room is really good. But then again thats a personal choice. If I had to stay there again, I would choose either 310 or 410 to stay in. 510 is the penthouse suite, which has the most stunning view, but I found it to be really expensive. Apart from this, one thing that needs to be borne in mind for this hotel is that their toilets wont impress you as much as the room. Now, don't get me wrong - they are really good, but out of the 4 rooms that we had, 2 bathrooms had major problems in them. One of them was really stinking - i think it was room 101 and one of them - 501 - had a clogged drain. I guess the hotel has every other staff, but a plumber is desperately required. Make sure that you choose a room which has no problems in the toilet. Personally, a good bathroom is really important to enhance the staying experience and the Bathrooms didn't really impress me. But i guess, the room makes up for it. Just make sure that there are no major problems in the bathroom before you check into the room. As far as the location goes, you couldn't get any better. The hotel is located just off Istiklal - which is the liveliest street in istanbul. Even then the hotel has some really peaceful surroundings. It has easy access to Tunel station from where you can get connecting trains and trams to all across Istanbul. The location could not get better for a tourist. All in all, I would highly recommend people to stay at this hotel. It will make your stay in Istanbul even more rocking ! :-) Happy Traveling. !!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly like it looks - modern, very comfortable, great location”
Reviews.Author: Massimo1
Reviews.Content: The Ansen Suites is a small residence that offers modern studio apartments, complete with everything you need for a comfortable stay. It's more homey and more spacious than just a room with a bed for the same price. It is superbly located in the middle of Istanbul's trendy Pera district (if you want some nightlife), with good transportation links. The room is exactly as you see in the photos. It was very quiet, nicely decorated in neutral colors and had a very calm feeling. The king-size bed was firm, but not hard, and the linens were excellent. The bathroom was spacious, with amenities, bathrobes, and luxurious towels. A very wide person could have a problem in the stand-up shower compartment. Water pressure was strong. The kitchenette was equipped for two people and had a fully stocked mini-bar/refrigerator and a dishwasher. The free WiFi had a strong signal. The included breakfast downstairs was a real sit-down breakfast: omelettes, cold platter, bread, coffee, juice. The owner was charming and gracious and the small staff friendly and extremely attentive. They all couldn't have been better. The restaurant downstairs is excellent. There is a small Dia supermarket about a half block away. The only minor negatives I can think of are that there are no blackout curtains (it still gets dark enough), that the rooms tend to be a little underlit, and that the door could have a more substantial lock (not a big concern). I would absolutely choose Ansen Suites for my next stay in Istanbul and I will recommend it to my friends. I wish I'd known about it the last time.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: FRAMASAIO
Reviews.Content: Big, stylish apartment, in quiet trendy area of town. All staff made you feel at home straight away. Very warm and extremely friendly welcome everytime. Great breakfast and coffee all included. Service was impeccable. Absolutely recommend it. Wonderful Italian restaurant part of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good but needs a little help plus minor scam”
Reviews.Author: jcquests
Reviews.Content: This is a nice small boutique hotel with an expensive restaurant. The staff is friendly enough and their English is pretty good. The room was clean and the service was marginal, they forgot to replenish toiletries and kitchenette supplies. Internet connectivity was free but a little spotty, especially at night. The location is not all that bad across the Golden Horn near the Galata Tower. A problem did come up when I went to pay my bill. Because I had already had a few scam issues come up in Istanbul I was a little gun shy, I was kind of worried about the bill. I booked for a room at one rate for three nights which meant I would get a 10% discount, as clearly advertised on the web site and through e-mail correspondence. When I arrived I was upgraded to a better quality room because the room I booked was not available but it was clear I would pay the same price as my original room rate. It was great to get a better room with a better view for my original rate. It seemed like it was a forced upgrade, but in any event it was nice to get the upgrade. When I went to pay my bill I was told that the 10% discount only applied if I was paying in cash. I know this scam because it had already been tried on me twice in restaurants, i.e., canâ€™t take your credit card because the purchase price is to small (actually the game/scam is to act like your credit card doesnâ€™t work on those neat little â€˜at your tableâ€™ credit card processing scanners). The gentlemen at Ansen kept telling me that I got such a great deal with my upgrade that the full price was really fair, which didnâ€™t have anything to do with paying cash. After going around and around for a while Ansen 130 Suites won out and I paid the full price with a credit card and no discount. Another Istanbul lesson learned. Count on some sort of scam for just about everything. To protect a little from this I would suggest that you totally, totally try to get clear on all Istanbul transactions before the bill arrives (before you commit to the purchase). I should have done this at the Ansen.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, friendly hotel in a great area of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: lynntrick
Reviews.Content: I would thoroughly recommend Ansen Suites 130. There were eight of us travelling together and our rooms were large and stylish, although the lighting could definitely be improved. Everything was very clean (except for the carpet in the lift!) and the service was exceptional. Orhan, the manager, said that he likes the hotel to feel like home. We felt genuinely cared for throughout our stay. Breakfast was large and pretty good and the Italian restaurant was also good. They were very happy to make reservations at other restaurants for us - and there is certainly no shortage of restaurants in Istanbul! Everyone seems to eat out all the time. Every night felt like Saturday night. The hotel is located in a good area, not too noisy at night, but close enough to shops, restaurants and the beautiful Bosphorus. There is a lovely lounge at the back of the hotel, which was perfect for our group of eight, once we managed to work out how to turn the music down. We will certainly go back to Ansen Suites if we return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tibell
Reviews.Content: The staff is wonderful. They could not do enough for us. Orhan, Ahmet,Hulya,Ortan,Mehmet and Paris deserve the highest praise for customer service. Our room was spacious, always clean. The hotel is small and cozy and everyone made us feel like family. We had a problem with a car and although it was early Mehmet made sure that we got a taxi and got to our destiation on time can't say enough about the staff or the comfortable room.

Reviews.Title: “A very good place!”
Reviews.Author: BrazilBackpack
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 2 days last April. The size of the room was amazing, great decoration, nice amenities, and a good location for the Istiklal Caddesi area. Staff very polite. I just didn't like the breakfast (few choices and very, very simple). Also, the breakfast area is the lobby of the hotel (kind of weird...) Overall, highly recommended if you want to stay in the Beyoglu district.

Reviews.Title: “great location, hospitable staff, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Panathinaeos
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay in Istanbul, away from the impersonal hotel boxes. The staff are hospitable and helpful. The rooms are like studios. I stayed in the penthouse and it was really great. The whole place is spotless. Its location is ideal, as you can wonder around in Pera and then use the public transportation system or a taxi to go where you want. The building is in the historic area of Pera (Beyoglou) with beautiful architecture all over. Although there are a lot of tourists around, this is an area inhabited by the people leaving in Istanbul. It is safe, clean, and very nice if you like city space.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointed but still very nice.”
Reviews.Author: Globtrotteur17
Reviews.Content: The location is GREAT, it is easy to find good restaurants and shops arround. The room was very dark, it needs more light. The kitchen equipment cannot be used... That is a shame because what is the point to have a kitchen in the room so? Otherwise, the staff is kind. Breakfast is a bit poor. Nevertheless it is a good hotel as the rooms are spacious (with sofa, desk, tables) and very clean. We recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Hip boutique hotel with delightful staff”
Reviews.Author: relucanttraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ansen 130 for 3 nights in mid-October. I had contacted the hotel previously to book my room plus arrange for airport pick up and inquiry about a Sema ceremony. I communicated with HÃ¼lya, the Sales and Marketing Manager, for my pre-trip planning, and she was helpful and thorough in explaining everything to me. It was my first time traveling to Istanbul/Turkey, and I arrived, unfortunately, sick from some my exhausting travel in India. The hotel staff was very sweet and offered me various cold remedies to help me feel better. I was always greeted with a smile and an offer of tea/coffee/water as soon as I walked through the door. They were also great at calling taxis for me whenever I needed to venture out. The rooms themselves were excellent. Large, suite-like (although more like a studio instead of a separate area for the living/desk part). But very large, modernly-decorated (I believe all the suites are themed). The bathroom was perfect size, great water pressure/hot water, all the amenities you would need during a hotel stay. A small-ish kitchen (which I didn't use), and free wireless throughout the hotel. All in all a great place and definitely highly recommended. I stayed at the Four Seasons in the Old City for the latter part of my stay (after returning from Cappadocia), and I honestly think I would have preferred to return back to Ansen 130. For the price, the warm hospitality, location, and overall service/aesthetic, I think Ansen 130 wins hands down.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - Lovely Decor - Tight Space”
Reviews.Author: east_bluff
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 days last month. We've found so much helpful information on this site before we went that we want to pay back by posting our experience. LOCATION: Great. It is within walking distance to Istiklal Caddesi and many busy restaurants. STAFF: Very friendly. They always try hard to get what you need. However, they do not speak any English. I communicated by writing the words down on paper, and they looked them up on the online dictionary. ROOM: Sleek decor but a bit clostrophobic. We stayed in the Executive Suite on the top floor. The fixtures throughout are very modern and of high quality in general. The room has 3 small round windows and 2 skylights. The square footage is great, but we felt there was not light and air coming in. When we notified the staff that one of the skylights' blind could not be open and the light bulb in the kitchenette went out, they could not get anyone to fix them. The elevator is very tight as well. RESTAURANT: Fresh ingredients and tasty. Breakfast is complementary. We really liked the foods. We wish we could have had more than 1 dinner there. Of note, we tried the Thai restaurant next door (because we had had Turkish foods x 10 days before that). We were the only 2 customers for the entire night. The meal cost $90 USD without alcohol. You can get the same food in California for $20. We would not recommend them. TAXI: Easy to get. The staff can call the taxi center which is 2 minutes away, across from the Petra hotel, and a taxi will show up in front of the hotel within 5 minutes. If possible, get a taxi that works at a hotel. They use the meter and state the hotel name on their business cards. It seems that there is a process they must pass before they can work in front of the hotel. If you take a taxi at one of the touristy sites such as Grand Bazaar or Blue Mosque, expect they jack up the price or not use the meter.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, friendly staff and excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: RobbieDubai
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ansen Suites for 2 nights and had no complaints whatsoever. The rooms are very large with plenty of space and a small kitchen area too. Bathrooms are small but very modern and clean. All the rooms are tastefully decorated and looks like the hotel itself is very new. The hotel has a family feel and even the reception area feels like someone's lounge! The decor is very nice with some modern and vintage art displayed in the reception. The staff were very helpful and gave us honest reccommendations on restaurants to visit which were excellent. The location is also excellent and right opposite the hotel is a cobbled street full of nice cafes and restaurants. It is also a 5 min walk to Istikal Caddesi - the main shopping street of Istanbul. I would go back there on my next trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing - will return”
Reviews.Author: vereker
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Ansen Suites for four nights in May and loved it. Our room was spacious and well decorated, it had a great view over the Golden Horn - ask for a room at the top of the building - and lovely staff. Great area too near lots of small bars and restaurants - not like the touristy sultanamet. You definitely want to stay on this side of the golden horn and you should think about staying here - walkable to everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “the best designed boutique ever !”
Reviews.Author: chloeshiny
Reviews.Content: We stayed there with my boyfriend for 2 nights.The design of the rooms are modern and for the people who dont like kitsch and old fashioned hotels.A little boutique hotel with all in one.There is a little kitchen with cooking equipment and almost everything you may need in bathroom.The staff is helpful and warm.They serve the most delicious breakfast ever as well.You can eat French toast with cinnamon and raisins,pancakes or the regular breakfast plate with newly baked tasty breads.-though their plate is too big for a "regular" one.- Next time i will definetely choose this hotel to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A good boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Ansen Suites in March of 2006. We were impressed by the place and had a great stay there. (We negotiate a pretty decent rate too so donâ€™t settle for the list price unless youâ€™re in peak season.) First off Istanbul is a dirty, polluted place. The food is plain (and mostly bad) and youâ€™d get a better kebab in Islington than even the best rated ocakbasi we went to (Timeout and HG2 recommended). The people you are most likely to meet are dodgy â€˜wheeler dealerâ€™ sorts (although not threatening) and you have a good chance of being palmed off with counterfeit notes! I have always wanted to go to Istanbul but frankly places like Rome, Madrid, Venice, Prague etc. had somewhat more appeal for me personally. I can say that whilst I wouldnâ€™t rush back, it is worth braving the negatives for â€“ that is if you have an interest in the history and want a break with more to it than caffeine laced art galleries. The Ansen Suites is a good boutique hotel for the money, by any cityâ€™s standards. We stayed in 2 rooms, being upgraded on our last night to the penthouse. Both were facing the ancient city, looking out over the â€˜Golden Hornâ€™ (the channel of water dividing the European side of the city) to the Blue Mosque which made for great views. The Penthouse was identical to the first room we had except it had uninterrupted panoramic views and a small terrace. In all other respects the rooms were identical. DÃ©cor â€“ modern and stylish; facilities â€“ broadband, satellite, hotel bar etc; bathroom â€“ shower (no baths) but very modern and with designer soaps etc.. The staff were friendly and helpful (and even (genuinely!) invited us to a very lively private party they had one night). Situation is pretty good, near the main shopping street and close by to quite a few of the best rated restaurants (although as I mention good food is hard to come by in Istanbul). It's a short (<5min) and hairy taxi ride from the blue mosque and the main sites. If you want to brave the pollution, dodgy dealers and pitiful tucker of Istanbul definitely stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Serene oasis with great space, food and service”
Reviews.Author: jeanspot
Reviews.Content: The Ansen Suites is a respite in a busy but exciting Istanbul. It's on the new city side so there are short cab rides to the major tourist attractions... but we felt the serene and beautiful space, excellent food and kindness of the staff to be worth it. Our rooms were really large suites with full kitchen, sitting areas, beautiful furniture and well appointed bathrooms. Impeccably clean. Large space. The views are not terrific because the area of the city is being rehabbed, but that didn't matter to us. The value was tremendous considering the cost of regular rooms in even higher star hotels. Great beds, fresh linens, amenities. Staff English is mixed but we got our points across. Either room service or dinner in the charming restaurant or bar was excellent. Deliciously prepared foods with large portions. Tremendous responsiveness to our needs. We would stay here again any time and recommend it without reservation. Safe area... lots of little shops in the area to pick up snacks, drinks, etc. Restaurants along the big shopping street of various types... including cafeterias. Enjoy your stay at the Ansen Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: SBtravelNy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a week in July. After reading about it in the NYT and checking out their website, I gave them a call. The reservationist gave me a discount on a suite that made it affordable. The suite was large and lovely. The hotel is a renovated Ottoman era building and the rooms are done up in a modernist style. Nice marble bathrooms, kitchens, sitting area, and comfortable bed. My room looked onto an old Ottoman building that is falling to pieces: it was great fun to look at (see picture below). The location is a great quiet side street in Beyoglu--though no taxis have heard of the place and you'll have to use nearby landmarks (like Peri Palace) to find your way back home. It's a 2 minute walk to the Bosphorus, a 5 minute walk from Istiklal and a short cab ride from Taksim. It was a great spot for visiting the meyhanes & galleries of Beyoglu. The only down side to this hotel is its staff. The manager/reservationist who works late afternoons and evenings is wonderful. The rest of the staff was quite new and unsure how to get things done. Room service always sounded a bit surprised when you rang. (I ended up making my own coffee in the morning and heading to the Marmara hotel up the street for breakfasts, from where I could easily catch a cab as well.) If you're in the city for business, you may not get the kind of support you need. But if you're a tourist, they couldn't be nicer and they'll make every effort to help you get what you need (so long as you aren't in a hurry). It was a long but interesting cab ride to the Sultanahmet area where I saw the sites (the Topkapi is a must see)...and I was so glad not to be staying at any of those hotels. I'll definitely stay here again when I return to Istanbul.

HotelInfo.Name: Ansen Suites
HotelInfo.Address: Mesrutiyet Caddesi NO: 70 | Tepebasi Tunel /Beyoglu, Istanbul 34430 , Turkey
